What is a limitation of using PBaaS chains in the Verus Desktop GUI for this testnet release?

In the Verus Desktop GUI, if a currency is already supported, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use the same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation will be resolved before mainnet availability.

2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.# DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk! What kind of software is being referred to in the Verus Desktop software disclaimer, and what kind of warranty or liability is provided?

The software being referred to is the Verus Desktop software, and it is experimental and unfinished. Why might Avast and Kaspersky flag the Verus Desktop software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Avast and Kaspersky might flag the Verus Desktop software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it includes mining software, which could potentially be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a false positive warning, and you can find more information about it in the provided resources.
